anime.description: 60 years ago, a strange case of insomnia struck the population, forcing them to stay awake for more than a full week. The victims, completely sleep deprived, all went mad. To cure this illness, a new medicine was produced, but the side effects turned the patients into vampires. Humanity went to war against this new species and triumphed, but some of the vampires managed to survive. Born from a human and a vampire, the main character Mi Liu, The Child of Hope, is to represent the new hope that will connect the two species. Ringleader of a bank robbery, Mi Liu is arrested and transferred to a special prison of the National Defense Agency that monitors vampires. Trying to break free with Anji, Mi Liu is attacked by strange monsters and he finds out that the prison location corresponds to the birthplace of vampires, the old capital Blue Town. Why are vampires trapped in Blue Town? What are those strange monsters attacking them? Our heroes must fight to solve those mysteries. Source: ANN

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: cyberpunk
tag.description: Cyberpunk focuses on computers or information technology, usually coupled with some degree of breakdown in social order. The plot often centres on a conflict among hackers, artificial intelligences, and mega corporations, tending to be set within a near-future dystopian Earth.

tag.name: car chases
tag.description: Car chases occur as part of the action setting in this anime.

tag.name: TV censoring
tag.description: The TV version is censored and later DVD/BD releases are uncensored, so the money-grubbing capitalists can make a couple more bucks at our expense.

tag.name: violence censoring
tag.description: Describes TV shows, where parts of the scenes considered as too violent are blackened, blurred, changed to other static screen, or cut out completely. While TV censoring is normally used to boost the BD/DVD sales, this is done under the mantle of being "for the healthy development of youth" or similar excuses. In the long run, it`s just the same. Examples: Deadman Wonderland, Fate/Zero, and Mirai Nikki.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: manhua
tag.description: The Chinese equivalent of the Japanese manga, produced in Mainland China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan. See also http://anidb.net/t2798 [manga] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 犠牲
Sacrifice
Sacrifice
Gisei
episode.summary: The bloodivores and hemomancers fight together to survive. However, their alliance is fleeting—no more than a false friendship. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 血能
Hemomancy
Les pouvoirs du sang
Ketsunou
episode.summary: Bloodivores and hemomancers are gathered at the prison. Then monsters suddenly appear. As questions and suspicions mount, Mi Ryu is forced to recall unpleasant memories from his childhood. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 覚醒
Awakening
Prise de conscience
Kakusei
episode.summary: Punished for a crime he didn`t commit, when he awoke, Miryu found himself inside a mysterious facility. Waiting for him there was a survival game of life and death. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嗜血種
Bloodivores
Les Bloodivores
Shiketsushu
episode.summary: A case of insomnia swept across the globe. As a side effect of the drug developed to suppress this sickness of causes unknown, the “bloodivores” were born. Born from bloodivore and human parents, protagonist Mi Ryu was known as “The Child of Hope” tying bloodivore and humankind together. However, when Miryu is arrested as the principal offender in a bank robbery, he is taken to a special prison operated by the Bureau of Special Threat Management for observing bloodivores. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カウントダウン
Countdown
Compte à rebours
Countdown
episode.summary: Why and how was Anji revived? Amidst the joy and confusion, a little traveling companion connected to the mystery joins the group. However, it is also the beginning of a new problem. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再会
Reunion
Retrouvailles
Saikai
episode.summary: Still unable to believe the truth, Mi Ryu continues aimlessly walking while carrying Anji as though it were his punishment. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 選択
Choices
Choix
Sentaku
episode.summary: The weak perish and the strong survive. As the bloodivores are tossed about by their cruel fate, Li Shin challenges Lu Yao, the strongest of the failures. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青玉
Sapphire
Saphir
Seigyoku
episode.summary: Anji`s wound is deep. To save her, Mi Ryu uses the data terminal forced on him by his father. However, through it he discovers a shocking truth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反撃
Counterattack
Contre-attaque
Hangeki
episode.summary: Mi Liu faces the monsters to save Yaya`s life. In his moment of desperation, he`s saved by Anji and her awakened hemomancy powers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Boom
Boom
Boom
Boom
episode.summary: Lee Shin continues his mindless rampage. Prepared to die, Mi Liu fights alone. As he fights, Anji and Chen Fong are forced to make a difficult decision. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 計画
Plan
Plan
Keikaku
episode.summary: After rejecting Lou Yao`s help, he returns to Anji and the others with uncertainty. There he encounters and awakened and deranged Lee Shin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一会
Meeting
Rencontre unique
Hajimekai
episode.summary: In order to save their new companion Yaya, Mi Ryu and company request Lu Yao`s help while fully aware of the risks. Will their deal with the devil turn out in their favor or turn against them? Source: crunchyroll
